diff_hunk:
@@ -656,6 +656,25 @@ def __getitem__(self, k):
             raise KeyError(k)
         return self.module._get_parameter(k)
 
+# types that can be constants. If you edit this list,
+# then you also need to edit the handlers in ConstantValue in jit/script/init.cpp
+_constant_types = [bool, float, int, Module, types.FunctionType]
body: Do you need to mark `nn.Module` as constant to be able to use it inside scripted functions? Also, it doesn't really mean that the module (as in its state, attributes, etc.) will remain constant, right? Only that this attribute won't be re-assigned later
body_html: Do you need to mark nn.Module as constant to be able to use it inside scripted functions? Also, it doesn't really mean that the module (as in its state, attributes, etc.) will remain constant, right? Only that this attribute won't be re-assigned later
body_text: Do you need to mark nn.Module as constant to be able to use it inside scripted functions? Also, it doesn't really mean that the module (as in its state, attributes, etc.) will remain constant, right? Only that this attribute won't be re-assigned later
